attributes.additional_details: David Cameron has said he's going to let THOUSANDS of migrants into the UK, but shouldn't we get a say? Shouldn't we get a vote? Shouldn't we have a voice? We need to take care of our own Army Vets, our homeless, our unemployed, our sick, instead we are expected to use our resources to help thousands of migrants who are not even here yet, and they should not be allow in either, say no now and vote to help our own before we help the Syrian migrants.
attributes.background: Immigration has always been a big problem in the UK, and now we're expected to stand idly by and allow more migrants into our country without saying a word, but this has to stop, we don't even take care of our own, why should we take care of them?

rejection.details:
We cannot accept duplicate petitions. We think this petition is similar to yours: 

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/107137

You might like to sign this petition instead. It is more likely to get more signatures that way.

There are also petitions calling for a referendum on this issue, and for priority to be given to British citizens for housing.
